text: Robert Luther "Lute" Olson (September 22, 1934 â€“ August 27, 2020) was an American Hall of Fame basketball coach. He was born in Mayville, North Dakota. He was also honored in the National Collegiate Basketball Hall of Fame (2006) and re-inducted in the class of 2019. He was the head coach of the University of Arizona's men's team for 25 years. He was also head coach at the University of Iowa for nine years and California State University, Long Beach for one season. On October 23, 2008, Olson announced his retirement from coaching. Olson died on August 27, 2020 under hospice care in Tucson, Arizona from stroke-related problems at the age of 85.Hall of Fame basketball coach Lute Olson dies at 85 ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American basketball players Category:American Lutherans Category:Centers (basketball) Category:College basketball coaches Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame inductees Category:Sportspeople from North Dakota Category:Sportspeople from Tucson, Arizona
title: Lute Olson
